title: New Covenant
overview: God's promise of a new relationship
key_application: Embrace the new covenant through faith in Christ
prayerPoints: Thank God for the new covenant in Christ
Ask for deeper relationship with God
Pray for those who need to know God's grace

Introduction.question: What does it mean to have a new heart?
Introduction.answer: Discuss the concept of having a new heart and the work of the Holy Spirit.

Introduction.question: How do you experience the Spirit's work in your life?
Introduction.answer: Explain how the Holy Spirit works in your life to transform you.

Introduction.question: What difference does the new covenant make in your relationship with God?
Introduction.answer: Discuss the difference the new covenant makes in your relationship with God.

Jeremiah 31:31-34.question: How is the new covenant different from the old?
Jeremiah 31:31-34.answer: The new covenant is different from the old because it is written on our hearts.

Jeremiah 31:31-34.question: What does it mean to have God's law written on our hearts?
Jeremiah 31:31-34.answer: It means that God's law is now written on our hearts and guides our behavior.

Jeremiah 31:31-34.question: How does this passage show God's initiative in salvation?
Jeremiah 31:31-34.answer: This passage shows God's initiative in salvation and the new relationship with Him.

Jeremiah 31:31-34.question: What does it mean that everyone will know the Lord?
Jeremiah 31:31-34.answer: It means that everyone will know the Lord through the new covenant.

Ezekiel 36:22-32.question: Why does God act for His own name's sake?
Ezekiel 36:22-32.answer: God acts for His own name's sake to demonstrate His holiness and righteousness.

Ezekiel 36:22-32.question: How does the Spirit's work transform us?
Ezekiel 36:22-32.answer: The Spirit's work transforms us into the image of Christ and enables us to live in accordance with God's law.

Ezekiel 36:22-32.question: What does this passage teach us about God's cleansing?
Ezekiel 36:22-32.answer: This passage teaches about God's cleansing and the work of the Holy Spirit in transforming us.

Ezekiel 36:22-32.question: What does this passage point to the work of Christ?
Ezekiel 36:22-32.answer: This passage points to the work of Christ in transforming us and enabling us to live in accordance with God's law.

Application.question: How can you live more fully in the reality of the new covenant?
Application.answer: Suggest practical ways to live out the new covenant in daily life.

Application.question: What areas of your life need transformation by the Spirit?
Application.answer: Help identify specific areas needing transformation.

Application.question: How can you better respond to God's work in your heart?
Application.answer: Encourage active participation in the Spirit's work.

Application.question: What steps can you take to know God more intimately?
Application.answer: Discuss spiritual disciplines that foster intimacy with God.

Application.question: How can you help others understand and experience the new covenant?
Application.answer: Share strategies for helping others understand the new covenant.
